body: @AndiDog feel free to contribute a fix if you manage to determine the issue.
@ian-howell would you mind taking a look into this? `parseTemplateError` was introduced in https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/5572.
It looks like this happens when there's an instance of `": "` in the important bit of the error message. I'll take a closer look and get a fix in

issue.title: fix(engine): Fix eating too many colons during template execution

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
This fixes #6044, in which error parsing is greedily eating too many
colons, preventing users from using colons in their warning messages to
the `required` function

Signed-off-by: Ian Howell <ian.howell0@gmail.com>

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Closes #6044 

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
I've arbitrarily decided to use the regex `HELM\[.*\]HELM`. This should probably be changed to something more unique, but works for a POC.

It should also be noted that the `parseTemplateError` has been split into two functions: one for parse errors, the other for execution errors. This lines up with the current usage of the `text/template` package.

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body:
So the `text/template` package does some pretty nasty things when it runs into an error while running a function. For example, this template:

```
{{- $foo := "" -}}
{{required "foo is required" $foo}}
```

creates the following error:
```
template: requiredTest:3:2: executing "requiredTest" at <required "foo is required" $foo>: error calling required: foo is required
```

That message has a ton of redundancy, but unfortunately no way to parse out the important bits without possibly treading on a user's toes (e.g. parsing on colons).

I've submitted [a Pull Request](https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/6066) which addresses this by inserting arbitrary delimiters around the user's warning message, then parsing out the message if an error occurs. The PR includes a unit test that addresses this specific issue.

issue.title: multiline stacktraces for error messages in helper functions

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Denotes an issue that needs help from a contributor. Must meet "help wanted" guidelines.

issue.body:
<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

Hey all,

I work on a pretty large helm chart. Whenever I encounter an issue,  theres a long oneline error message that's pretty hard to read.  one such example is described by this repository (https://github.com/jessesimpson36/helm_error_format)

> Error: INSTALLATION FAILED: template: camunda-platform/templates/zeebe-gateway/deployment.yaml:90:24: executing "camunda-platform/templates/zeebe-gateway/deployment.yaml" at <include "camundaPlatform.authIssuerBackendUrl" .>: error calling include: template: camunda-platform/templates/camunda/_helpers.tpl:197:10: executing "camundaPlatform.authIssuerBackendUrl" at <include "identity.keycloak.url" .>: error calling include: template: camunda-platform/templates/identity/_helpers.tpl:194:9: executing "identity.keycloak.url" at <include "identity.keycloak.port" .>: error calling include: template: camunda-platform/templates/identity/_helpers.tpl:174:23: executing "identity.keycloak.port" at <.Values.identityKeycloak.service.ports>: wrong type for value; expected map[string]interface {}; got interface {}


I built an [awk script](https://github.com/jessesimpson36/helm_error_format/blob/main/format_error.awk) that would format this to be the following:

And this awk script would output the following:

```
 Error: INSTALLATION FAILED:
   template: camunda-platform/templates/zeebe-gateway/deployment.yaml:90:24:
     executing "camunda-platform/templates/zeebe-gateway/deployment.yaml"
      at <include "camundaPlatform.authIssuerBackendUrl" .>:
 error calling include:
   template: camunda-platform/templates/camunda/_helpers.tpl:197:10:
     executing "camundaPlatform.authIssuerBackendUrl"
      at <include "identity.keycloak.url" .>:
 error calling include:
   template: camunda-platform/templates/identity/_helpers.tpl:194:9:
     executing "identity.keycloak.url"
      at <include "identity.keycloak.port" .>:
 error calling include:
   template: camunda-platform/templates/identity/_helpers.tpl:174:23:
     executing "identity.keycloak.port"
      at <.Values.identityKeycloak.service.ports>:
 wrong type for value; expected map[string]interface {}; got interface {}
```

I would like this nicer form of error message to be supported directly in helm without my AWK script.

I admit, since creating that awk script, I would prefer if my error format  worked well with vim's `errorfile` functionality, which lets you jump to each file + line number. So I'd like a cleaner multiline format than my awk script outputs.

I would be willing to write a HIP for this if you'd like.

Output of `helm version`:

version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.14.3", GitCommit:"f03cc04caaa8f6d7c3e67cf918929150cf6f3f12", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.21.7"}

Output of `kubectl version`:

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.):
